# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

-   R-Ladies is a world-wide organization with the mission of promoting **gender diversity in the R community**

-   Started in San Francisco in 2012 and now has **225 chapters** globally (check out rladies.org for more information)

![](img/rladies2023.jpg){fig-align="center"}

# R-Ladies St. Louis

Started in September 2017 by Jenine Harris and Chelsea West

<br>

Co-organizers for **`2024-25`** include:

-   Jenine Harris (Washington University)\
-   Mary Painter (University of Colorado, Boulder)\
-   Shelly Cooper (Washington University)\
-   Crystal Lewis (Freelance Data Management Consultant)\
-   Laura Rose (Hinge Health)

# About tonight's speaker

- M. Kathleen Caulfield has been using R for 9 years to clean and analyze psychology research data
- She works as an Associate Research Analyst at Reason Research and provides data management support for the University of Pittsburgh's CNMA lab, where she earned her Master's
- She loves teaching, cooking, and those rare occasions when the code Just Runs
